text: Are there programmatic tools for Perl to Python conversion?
In my new job more people are using Python than Perl, and I have a very useful API that I wrote myself and I'd like to make available to my co-workers in Python.
I thought that a compiler that compiled Perl code into Python code would be really useful for such a task.
Before trying to write something that parsed Perl (or at least, the subset of Perl that I've used in defining my API), I came across bridgekeeper from a consultancy.
It's almost certainly not worth the money for me to engage a consultancy to translate this API, but that's a really interesting tool.
Does anyone know of a compiler that will parse (or try to parse!
) Perl5 code and compile it into Python?
If there isn't such a thing, how should I start writing a simple compiler that parses my object-oriented Perl code and turns it into Python?
Is there an ANTLR or YACC grammar that I can use as a starting point?
Edit: I found perl.y, which might be a starting point if I were to roll my own compiler.
